intent_atoms.description: Consolidate scattered manual badge implementations in ISOInspectorApp into consistent, reusable FoundationUI components (DS.Badge and DS.Indicator) for displaying parse status, error levels, and processing indicators.
All manual badges replaced with DS.Badge (CorruptionBadge, SeverityBadge, ParseStateBadge).
ParseTreeStatusBadge wrapper uses DS.Badge for parse status levels.
Component migration completed: no dedicated BoxStatusBadgeView or ParseStatusIndicator wrappers needed; reusing ParseTreeStatusBadge.
Unit test coverage ≥90% for badge variants (33 Badge tests inherited from Phase 0).
Snapshot tests pass for all variants in light/dark modes, covering all 4 status levels.
Accessibility tests verify VoiceOver labels, contrast ratios, focus (WCAG 2.1 AA compliance via FoundationUI Badge).
Zero SwiftLint violations and build time impact <5%.
No performance regressions in tree rendering.
All status indicators use DS.Badge component; DS.Indicator not used at this time.
Consistent visual language across light/dark modes.
Accessibility compliance (VoiceOver, contrast, focus) must always hold for badges.
Use DS.Badge component for all status indicators; re-use ParseTreeStatusBadge wrapper instead of creating new BoxStatusBadgeView or ParseStatusIndicator components.
Platform-adaptive sizing via FoundationUI and use of DS.PlatformAdaptation for size/spacing differences.
